page.title: 10FARMING ON THE DOWNS
page.content: The area of the Downs within the D-block is largely undulating{ chalk {hills,}most of which is owned and farmed by several land owners. We interviewed Mr. McCulloch who farms at Thurle Grange. He owns 300 acres of land, but he farms 500 acres. The soil is chalky so the rain water drains well. Mr. McCulloch grows {wheat, barley and triticale.}Triticale is a hybrid of wheat and rye which is used to feed animals. The farmer owns 250{Friesian {bulls.}They are fattened for beef and then sold. He has{a flock of sheep and{17 horses}as well as running a livery yard. He employs 5 staff who use machinery to help them. There is 1 combine and many tractors.
